p: In adults, especially middle-aged women, joint pain and swelling (immune-mediated polyarthropathy) may appear involving the joints of the hands, feet, or knees (Moore 2000). Joint symptoms can be seen in 8 % of children and 60 % of infected adults. This may be the only manifestation of the infection in these patients. The inflammatory joint symptoms may persist for weeks to months but usually resolve without long-term damage (Tello-Winniczuk et al. 2011; Naides et al. 1990; Kerr et al. 1995). There have been scattered reported cases of fibromyalgia symptoms linked to PVB19 via IgM serology (Buyukkose et al. 2009). A causal relationship with fibromyalgia is uncertain as the PV infection may be incidental, in some cases.
